body_html:
@vingovan Earlier, I got an error using CUDA 9.0 as - The GPU Driver (GPU Name: Persistence-M; NVIDIA-SMI 396.26) is not TensorFlow compatible. (Below is my Linux screenshot).

2018-05-24 22:08:28.707495: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_device.cc:1406] Ignoring visible gpu device (device: 0, name: GRID K520, pci bus id: 0000:00:03.0, compute capability: 3.0) with Cuda compute capability 3.0. The minimum required Cuda capability is 3.5.

Any idea on this ? Could you please tell me what CuDNN version you used ?

What is your Architecture Configuration ? Is it AWS (4.4.0-1060-aws) with g2.2X large ?

Thanks.

body:
@ViNgoVan Earlier, I got an error using CUDA 9.0 as - The GPU Driver (GPU  Name: Persistence-M; NVIDIA-SMI 396.26) is not TensorFlow compatible. (Below is my Linux screenshot).

2018-05-24 22:08:28.707495: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_device.cc:1406] Ignoring visible gpu device (device: 0, name: GRID K520, pci bus id: 0000:00:03.0, compute capability: 3.0) with Cuda compute capability 3.0. The minimum required Cuda capability is 3.5.

Any idea on this ? Could you please tell me what CuDNN version you used ?

What is your Architecture Configuration ? Is it AWS (4.4.0-1060-aws) with g2.2X large ?

Thanks.
